components.description: A large division symbol, as used in mathematics.
components.title: Heavy Division Sign

description: A large division symbol, as used in mathematics.
title: Heavy Division Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Dingbats -> Heavy variants of arithmetic symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Heavy Division Sign was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/heavy-division-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: heavy division sign

bn:00084611v: To divide fully or partly along a more or less straight line.
To divide (a thing) into separate parts.
Of something solid, to divide fully or partly along a more or less straight line.
Divide along a more or less straight line.

bn:00014689n: Deliberate process that transforms inputs to outputs with variable change
The act, process or result of calculating.
A calculation is a deliberate process that transforms one or more inputs into one or more results, with variable change.
The act or process of computing; calculation; reckoning.
Problem solving that involves numbers or quantities
The act or process of calculating.
The act or process of computing.

bn:02129917n: An obelus is a symbol consisting of a short horizontal line with a dot above and below.
Any symbol (in particular ÷ or / ) used to denote the operation of division.
A symbol consisting of a horizontal line with a dot above and below, chiefly used to represent division in mathematics.

bn:00053823n: Mathematics is the study of topics such as quantity, structure, space, and change.
The application of principles associated with Cavalieri's principle.
The science that deals with concepts such as quantity, structure, space and change.
An abstract representational system used in the study of numbers, shapes, structure, change and the relationships between these concepts.
A science (or group of related sciences) dealing with the logic of quantity and shape and arrangement
Mathematics is the body of knowledge centered on concepts such as quantity, structure, space, and change, and the academic discipline which studies them.
Abstract study of numbers, quantity, structure, relationships, etc.

bn:00075652n: A symbol is an object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, visual image, belief, action, or material entity.
Symbols are things such as particular forms or marks which represent some sort of information, an idea, a physical entity or a process but is distinct from it.
In programming, a name that represents a register, an absolute value, or a memory address (relative or absolute).
A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
One or a few characters, a picture or an other concrete representation of an idea, a concept and the like.
An object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, belief, action, or material entity
An arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance
Something that represents an idea, a process, or a physical entity

apple_vendor_description: The divide emoji on Apple devices is presented as a clean, mathematical symbol, typically a horizontal line with a dot above and a dot below. Rendered with Apple's signature smooth gradients and subtle 3D depth, it appears precise and easy to understand. This emoji is primarily used in mathematical contexts to represent division, or metaphorically to signify separation, splitting, or a clear distinction between two things.
